ygData.msgSnippet: Tyrael: I have no proof of that, but these minions... They re not like Galvatron of any other he made during the Great Wars. They are made out of him, I think,

Tyrael: I have no proof of that, but these minions... They're not 
like Galvatron of any other he made during the Great Wars. They are 
made out of him, I think, since they have the same energy signature 
as that found all over Cybertron when he was defeated.

He remained silent.

Tyrael: It could be that these minions are only here to replenish 
forces. Let's hope for that...

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> wrote:
> : : Darkangel : :
> 
> Angel's optics grew wide at the mention of the chaos bringer. That 
was what Tyrael had been talking about on the bridge. Could he be 
right?
> 
> Darkangel: You think that these bots serve him and have come to 
prepare for him? Minions like Galvatron, Cyclonus, Scurge and the 
sweeps once were. Unicron is coming... here!
> 
> 
> Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> Tyrael: Unicron... It was Unicron...
> 
> Four simple words, loaded with meaning. To Tyrael, it spelled doom 
> for this entire planet, notwithstanding his own plans.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
wrote:
> > : : Darkangel : :
> > 
> > Darkangel looks out a window at the landscape of Earth. He sighs, 
> thinking about the coming troubles.
> > 
> > Darkangel: This certinely changes the balance of things...
> > 
> > 
> > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > Tyrael: You're right. And if now we are stuck with to of them, 
then 
> > it can get worse... I hate this twist of events...
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
> wrote:
> > > : : Darkangel : :
> > > 
> > > Darkangel: I think we need to find out as much about this bot 
as 
> we 
> > can, quickly. He's too strong for me to feel safe.
> > > 
> > > 
> > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > Tyrael was amazed. For a single bot to manage what he could not 
> > do... 
> > > impressive!
> > > 
> > > Tyrael: I am afraid I know nothing about this... visitor of 
> yours. 
> > I 
> > > will look at what I can do, then, if we need to do something, I 
> > will 
> > > contact you.
> > > 
> > > He closed the line.
> > > 
> > > Tyrael: Your opinion, Darkangel?
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "airly2000" <airly2002@h...> 
wrote:
> > > > Hydras:
> > > > 
> > > > "I was visited by a impertitnent bot and we have a... sever 
> > > > fight"replied Hydras"This bot's signature didn't match with 
any 
> > > > register signature that I have... I wonder if you has been 
> > visited 
> > > > too or if you have an idea what's going here... 'cause I have 
> the 
> > > > feeling that something big and dangerous it's around"
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <Proudwing500k@h...> 
wrote:
> > > > > Tyrael was about to explain himself when Hydras's voice 
> boomed 
> > in 
> > > > the 
> > > > > speakers.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Tyrael: Stay with me, Darkangel. I'll just get done with 
him 
> > and 
> > > > then 
> > > > > I'll explain. (Opening communication) Hydras, what can I do 
> for 
> > > > you?
> > > > > 
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen 
> <roborick007@y...> 
> > > > wrote:
> > > > > > : : Darkangel/DeathStar : :
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Darkangel smiled behind his faceplate, taking pride in 
> being 
> > > > named 
> > > > > sub-commander. He winked at Dreadplague before she left, 
then 
> > > > quickly 
> > > > > followed Commander Tyrael.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Darkangel: I take it you theory spell possible doom for 
us 
> > all?
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > DeathStar walked along side Dreadplague.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > DeathStar: There was, but I'm unsure of what has come of 
> him.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Once outside the base, DeathStar changed to starfighter 
> mode, 
> > > > > flying towards the unknown signatures.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > Tyrael: I have a vague hypothesis... too fearsome to 
speak 
> of 
> > > > here. 
> > > > > I 
> > > > > > don't want to believe in it, but it seems to be the only 
> one 
> > > > > > possible...
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > He stopped. His face was grave and his eyes showed fear. 
> The 
> > > > Blue 
> > > > > > Phoenix, afraid?!
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Tyrael: Dreadplague, Deathstar, go investigate the two 
> > > > signatures 
> > > > > at 
> > > > > > these coordinates. If they are hostiles, do NOT engage. I 
> > want 
> > > > only 
> > > > > > data for now. Darkangel, I need your assistance and your 
> > > advice. 
> > > > > You 
> > > > > > are now officially my Second in command. Follow me please.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > He left the room and went to the lab.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Dreadplague was wide eyed.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Dreadplague: Congratulations, Angel! We'll have to 
> celebrate 
> > > > when I 
> > > > > > come back... (she had said that low enough that only 
> > Darkangel 
> > > > had 
> > > > > > heard) Come Deathstar. Let's do this and be done. Oh, by 
> the 
> > > > way, 
> > > > > > wasn't there someone with you?
> > > > > >
